Reviews.Title: “Ramada inn”
Reviews.Author: Jo D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was old and needed updates Garbarge was left lying around for days The hotel smelled like chlorine from a closed outdoor pool The staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great value - good service”
Reviews.Author: Aussiesandy77
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 2 nights. We chose the Ramada because of the very reasonable price over other Boston hotels. The hotel is a little ways out of the main part of the city but with the courtesy shuttle to the JFK/UMass train stop it made everything very convenient & easy to get to. The hotel layout is a little confusing with all the additions and extra doorways & hallways. Our room was clean, a good size and we were pleasantly surprised to find that we had a fridge & microwave in our room. The only problem with our room was the noisy heat/ac unit but we were so tired after our long days in the city that it didn't bother us too much. The breakfast that was included with our stay was very good (eggs, waffles, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, muffins). All of the staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, as were the shuttle drivers.We would definitely stay here again when visiting Boston just for all the little extras that were included. (Shuttle, breakfast, free parking, free wifi in our room)

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle provides good access to downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: v4300s
Reviews.Content: My two teenaged grandchildren and I stayed at this hotel for our first trip to Boston in August, 2011. We chose this hotel because of reasonable price and free shuttle service to and from the airport and subway stop. The first night we were given a room with damages and in an unusual and inconvenient location. We were given a much better room for the following three nights. The second room was a good location, clean, and with comfortable beds. The layout of the hotel was very confusing. It was time to leave before I was comfortable that I could locate the front lobby by myself. I was very disappointed in the area and did not feel comfortable walking at night. In addition to the above, there was confusion regarding my bill and the "hold" on my credit card. The guest computer in the lobby was not working during our stay. The shuttle service was the greatest asset. We utilized it to and from the airport, and daily to the subway. It was extremely dependable. I would be willing to stay here again because of the reasonable price. I would know what the weak areas are and address them from the beginning so that there would not be problems.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced family hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanguare
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this location during a family trip to Boston. We are familiar with Boston and its public transportation system (the "T"), and were pleased with the ease and predictability of the shuttle service that took us right to JFK/UMass. From there we could go anywhere, and we did, using our 7-day T passes ($15 each, a real deal). Parking in a T lot would have cost, but here we left our car in the hotel parking lot and rode in to the safe, convenient T stop. We enjoyed the free breakfast, which included waffles as well as fruit, eggs, cereal, and yogurt. Another terrific savings. Six of us were comfortable in two rooms, and the staff was helpful in providing extra towels and anything else we requested. This building is old, and being updated; I don't mind old, and I do love economy.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: arpie05
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Ramada Inn. We do not like motels that have outside doors for safety reasons. It's a motel not a hotel. It also has been added on so the layout is confusing. We actually stayed here in July 2009 and when it came up in my search, I knew I needed to write a review. The Subway stop that it is "close to" is scary. I thought we'd be killed as it was so far out of town and graffiti was all over the station. There is no way from this station you could walk anywhere - it seems like you in the middle of no where. The motel was noisey with kids. We never left the motel to go to bowling alley. I thought the station was close enough to JFK Library - no way - never saw the Library. It is a long (6-10 min) ride from station to motel. The breakfast was fine. The manager was very nice. Due to hating Boston so much we flew home early (I think mostly because I felt so unsafe at this hotel and the town is so expensive) and the manager let me use his computer to make arrangements due to the guest computer being down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, acceptable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Becky Jo S
Reviews.Content: I LOVED the free shuttle & Breakfast. The hotel is also located right next to a bowling alley and some great restaurants (as well as an amazing Chocolate store). I cannot say enough about how amazing the service was. They really went above and beyond. The breakfast was pretty good and the room was acceptable. You get what you pay for so don't expect a 4 star room. If you know what you are paying for this is a GREAT deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and Park”
Reviews.Author: markamcdowell
Reviews.Content: I am glad I had my GPS to find this place. I saw the hotel from I-93, but in Boston that doesn't mean it will be easy to get to. This Ramada Inn is about 15 minutes from Logan and has an afordable Stay and Park rate. The shutlle to the airport runs 24/7 plus service to the T. The rooms was clean and otherwise okay. The service is that famous Northeastern hospitality (brisk and not too warm). This Ramada is part of a complex with two decent resturants and a bowling alley. i will probably avoid staying here again. They insisted on copying (Xeroxing) my drivers license. I think this is totally unneccssary, an invasion of my privacy and opens me to identiy theft.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Hotel Boston USA”
Reviews.Author: janetbanfield
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent base for Boston.A little out of town but an excellent shuttle service to and from Airport and to the nearest Metro station. Very informative driver of shuttle bus.Liam who gave us a good historical commentary on our trips. Hotel was very helpful especially when key cards went wrong. Limited eating facilities in immediate area. but breakfasts were good.

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: Girlygirl322
Reviews.Content: I had medium expectations for this hotel,since it was a price line deal,but it was far worse then I ever thought. We had to go through a very cold and dirty hall way on the ground floor to get to the room and once inside I didn't want to touch anything, because it was all very grimy. We had to turn on the heater to warn things up, but it was so dusty and dirty that I started sneezing and getting stuffed up. There was a bad smell from the air that got worse as the room warmed up. Unfortunately we booked for 2 nights and had no real choice but to stay. We would definitely not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple, affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Stefaroundtheglobe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to save money since all of the hotels in downtown are super expensive ($300 and up). Its about a 10-15 min drive from the main attractions in the city. It's a quiet, clean hotel, a great value for the money. Here are some of the perks: - Free wi-fi! - Continental breakfast complimentary. Includes waffles, pastries, juices, coffee, yogurt. - Free parking - complimentary coupon book including coupon for free fudge at Phillips Candy House next door, a free beer and free clam chowder at the restaurants next door. - Free airport shuttle and shuttle to the subway every 30 min until 11 pm - Lots of huge, fluffy pillows on the beds. I really enjoyed staying here. The staff is friendly and attentive. Its no fancy hotel, the decor is outdated, and the elevator is a little questionable, but if you dont care about that, it's a great place to stay and save money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Belmira P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ramada Inn from October 21 to 29, 2011. It was great ! They have a perfect shuttle from airport to hotel, and from hotel to the train station. Although a little far from downtown, I recomend this hotel as they have a very good breakfast, free internet and confortable free transportation. The room was very good at the 3rd floor, clean. The air condition and the shower were excelent. Their very near restaurant is very, very good. We rented a car with Enterprise, the company recomended by the hotel. Perfect ! Belmira Petrucci

Reviews.Title: “Different than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: staciarn01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ramada inn for an overnight stay prior to flying out of Logan airport the next morning. First we had to bring our vehicle on the other side of the hotel to park it for the week ( which worried me a little) and then we had to bring our luggage through two heavy glass doors to get to the most unsafe elevator I have ever been in. There was no inspection sticker inside it either. The moment we stepped Onto the third floor there was a strong odor that smelled like urine. The hallway had a large stain on the carpet where I assume the source was. Of course we were placed in the last room at the end of the hallway. On our return from our trip we had to wait about 50min before the shuttle picked us up after I had called and they stated about 20min. Apparently the driver was in route to come and get us and was called back to the hotel to bring a crew to the cruise dock before coming to get us!!!! We will never stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Me”
Reviews.Author: lskaye
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs work. We stayed here on September 27, 2010 before a flight on the 28th. When we first walked in, there was a hole the size of a softball in the carpet. Another three very worn places near the sink. I'm not sure the last time a vacuum was used in this room. I made sure I always had my shoes on and never bare footed. I needed to recharge my I Pad and was going to unplug a lamp. The grease and grime on the plug was so dirty I decided to recharge at the airport. In the bathroom, the tile around the base was filthy. On the outside it appears they enclosed the walkway leading to the rooms for the 1st and 2nd floor. Betweeen room 170 and 171 there is a card reader to swipe your room key to gain entrance. At the end of the hall at room 175 there is an open door that you can open from the outside without any security at all--just walk in. The real kicker in our room was at 9:30 p.m. when we were watching tv, someone opened our door. The chain was on, but it was only attached with one screw. It wouldn't take much of a push to tear it off the door. The real problem was that the dead bolt was in place, but it opened also. The front desk had given a card to our room to someone else. Just an hour before we had been at dinner. What would have happened if we had still been gone?? THEN the front desk told my husband they would refund $50 from the room charge. We are now home...I just checked the credit card statement, and they charged us DOUBLE for the room then deducted the $50. I will not be staying at this or any other Ramadas again. This is a case where Ramada has taken money from customers and run. They should be ashamed of theirselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but there was a bit of a commute..”
Reviews.Author: Spangly1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Ramada and found it was good value for money. However, it might be worth spending a bit more to stay closer to the city as the commute limited what we could do in the centre of Boston. There were good points about the hotel. Firstly the shuttle was good and always on time. We also used this do get from the airport, which saved us about 35 dollars. We also used this everyday to get to the T and the shuttle drivers were generally helpful and informative. Breakfast was also surprisingly good - there were eggs, bagels, muffins and waffles everyday and this was all complimentary. The rooms were sizable but were quite outdated in their decor. We also found the locks on the door were a bit dubious. However they were clean and offered everything we needed. The only downside was the area the hotel was based in. There were quite a few facilities in the complex - there is a bowling alley which did reasonable food. There's also the Freeport tavern which does dinners and brunch, but we did find this to be quite expensive and preferred the food in the bowling alley. There was a supermarket, pharmacy and bank in walking distance which were useful also. In regard to other dining places and bars, there were no others which meant our nightlife was somewhat limited. If I was to stay in Boston again I would pay the extra to stay closer to the city, but this was a good value option as we were on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “You get, what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: tom_brd
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a very basic and very average hotel and I stayed here for the 2nd time whild attending an exhibition. The hotel has a free shuttle from/to the airport and to the close train station that takes you to downtown Boston. The hotel would need some maintenance and some updating. The rooms and furniture is quite old. The office chair at the desk was worn out. I canÂ´t complain - but you get, what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money but wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Kristine0210
Reviews.Content: Yes, it has a swimming pool and yes, it offers free breakfast but still, I won't stay here again. The a.c.'s (ours was very loud!) are all mounted under the windows and all the air exits in the hallway... The hallway is not really comfortable, that's the least I can say. Then, in the stairways, they put the large trash can where everyone could dump larger trash. We were there in July, so it was very hot and everytime you had to take the stairs you had to pass the trash cans which smelled so bad.... I had to hold my breath everytime. The beds are okay, bathrooms are okay. We skipped breakfast because it wasn't good. Elevator was broke during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “FREE Shuttle service makes it”
Reviews.Author: MaryCollier
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights here in July at the beginning of a 3 wk holiday. Found hotel to be v good value. Hotel is old but v clean and v good continental breakfast and fantastic management who were on hand overseeing their brilliant COMPLIMENTARY shuttle service at all times. During our 5 day stay we did so much and we did not spend one cent on transport which meant a great deal. The shuttle bus brought us from airport to hotel on the Monday. We took bus tour of city next 2 days and the tour bus picked us up each morning at hotel and dropped us back each evening. Next day we got hotel shuttle to JFK station where we picked up another free bus to JFK museum. On the Friday we got hotel shuttle back to airport for our flight to NYC. On a couple of occasions I saw management outside the hotel checking times of shuttles and on one occasion when shuttle was delayed in traffic I saw management organise passengers in a managers car and brought to airport by car. I was amazed by this efficiency and at the time commented how Ireland had a long way to come in promoting tourism. I would definitely go back and since my return to Ireland have recommended it already..... Saying by no means plush but free transport outweighs seeing Boston. So unusual to go to a city particularly the states and not spend a cent on transport. We also loved the choice of restaurants nearby and unfortunately didn't get time to avail of the bowling next door. Collier family, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “We would love to be back with a few adjustments”
Reviews.Author: longhi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and reasonably priced. The continental breakfast was terrific. The maid service was okay. It would have been nice if they filled up the kleenex holder after they cleaned our room. The other thing I would suggest is that you watch your bill. They overcharged me by $10 a night from the original reservation quote and I almost attributed it to taxes until I looked more closely at the bill.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the best if you're visiting colleges in Boston and surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: JacksReviews
Reviews.Content: We took a college trip up to Boston and we were very happy that we didn't have to worry about the commute in Boston and the MA area. We are from New York City and walking in Boston seemed like a breeze; the T line stops are at a walking distance from each other in the downtown or sightseeing area. We were really pleased with the Ramada Inn Hotel because they provide shuttle service to and from the T Line train station closest to them which is JFK/U Mass. You do not have to worry about taking a taxi to take you back to your hotel. We were really happy that we could save money this way. We got a weekly pass for $15 which allows you to transfer from train to bus and vice versa and ferry and you don't have to wait 16 min to use the pass like we do in NYC. In addition, the hotel provided a complimentary breakfast which also saved us money. It's self-service & buffet style because you can eat as much as you'd like. They had juice, coffee, tea, toast, eggs, hot chocolate, cereal, and you could make your own waffles. Simple breakfast but enough to start your morning unless your picky. There's also a restaurant next door and you could pay for the kind of breakfast you desire. Lastly, the hotel also opened the pool from 9am-9pm, and provided free access to a bowling alley across the hotel, free access to their business center and they hold your bags for you if you want to enjoy your last day without the worry of carrying your luggage. Note if you're seeing colleges and you're budgeting: the T line trains and buses can take you to Tufts, MIT, Boston University, Northeastern and other schools but if you're going to Brandeis, you'll have to take the Railroad which is about $10 roundtrip per person. Be aware that the railroad is more depending on what zone you're visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Fees, Hot Hallways, Standing Room Breakfast and Sloppy Maid Service”
Reviews.Author: WolfieMan
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn Boston claims to ne the "Best Value In Boston" but with that value comes a price. Upon arrival we found out room through the maze of extremely hot hallways witihn yards of a water accident that they had and the hallways rugs were flooded. We went into out room and there was no coffee set ups, no cups, and no toilet paper. Everyday we stayed there the maid forgot at least 1-2 things weather it be coffee, toiletries, or awalys a different amount of towels. The breakfast is the usual fare but does include scambled eggs and waffles. The problem is thatr the size of the room is like a postage stamp and its very hard to get a table to eat. The rooms are dated, the matresses old spring ones. The color television was one of those big old clunky old tube models and the A/C while efficent was extremely noisy. But heres the kicker. There is an additional charge of $3.00 a day added to every rroom that most people don't know about if you book through any other site other than the Ramada. And this $3,00 surcharge is to cover the "free" internet, breakfast, and shuttle. Which turns out not to be free after all.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: callensen
Reviews.Content: Boston is a very expensive place to visit. We tried to find a hotel that was cheaper in price ($119) a night. The Ramada Inn was a little aways from the city (in Dorchester) however the hotel did have a shuttle from the airport to the hotel as well as a shuttle from the hotel to the subway station for its guest. This was free. If you signed up for the Bean Town trolley this also came to the hotel to pick you up and drop you off. Unfortunatel it was onl at 8:30am and drop off at 4:30pm. Therefore if you missed it you were out of luck. We did have a hard time locating the room. The room numbers are not in order and when we asked for help in finding out room, the front desk did not seem too bothered by it. We ended up getting the lifeguard by the pool to show us to our room. The hotel itself was a little old and dirty. The carpet in the hotel was stained and wet. Also the bathroom tub was dirty and clogged. Rooms were small and the air conditioner was broken and made lots of noise. We were unable to switch rooms because the hotel was completel booked. The hotel did have a community computer with free internet. The complimentary breakfast had very little options and everything was stale. Not a lot of room to eat, alot of guest were taking the food back to their rooms. If you are you just looking for somewhere cheap to sleep, this is the place. If you plan on spending any time in the room, you may want to look for something else.

Reviews.Title: “won't come back”
Reviews.Author: tgzhou
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed with and my biggest complain is about the staff (though the location is also bad). We arrived at the hotel around 2:30 and was told by the lady at the front desk that our room was not ready so we could not check in. That's okay since it's hotel's policy that the check in time is 3:00. I asked her if there was a nearby place we could stay for 30 min before we came back. She shrugged and didn't say anything. Then just before I left, she called me back and told me actually we could check in. I asked her if it's possible to get a room not facing Rt. 93 (a very busy and noisy highway which is just a few yards away). She told me that our room was good. During that period of 10-15 min, she never smiled. On the way to the room, we became very disappointed. The rug we stepped on was very watering and our shoes got very wet. The room was at the end of the building and right underneath the highway. The AC was very loud. Thought this would be a horrible room to stay for two nights, I went back to the front desk to ask the lady there if we could be moved to the 2nd floor. While I was waiting, there were two other guests before me. The lady was quite friendly to them. She explained to them how they could take the shuttle to subway station which left me wondering why she didn't told me the info. When it's my turn, I told her we wanted to change the room. She looked at the computer in front of her for a few seconds before told me it's not possible since all room were booked. I asked her one more time and got the same answer. Then again, just before I left, she told me there was a room on the 2nd floor which we could move in. Our experience with the shuttle was not good either. The next morning, after the breakfast, we went to the front door to wait for the shuttle to take us to the subway station. There were total about 15 people when the shuttle (a Godge van) arrived. The driver came out and announced that he could only pick up six from us. when we asked him when he could come back, he said something like if I told that I could be back in five min, would you believe me? Didn't want to deal with such strange guy, we decided to drive our car instead. The next day, while eating breakfast, the shuttle driver came into the dinning room and started chatting with someone. A boy came to him to ask him when he would leave and he told him to wait. While he was chatting, I noticed more and more people gathering outside and waiting, some with very little kids. Finally the driver left the dinning room and told those waiting for him that he could not pick all of them up... (It took only a few min to go to the subway station and he could easily take care all people by one or two extra trips. To me what he did was to discourage people to use the shuttle service.) Though the hotel is just a few yards from Rt. 93, it takes about 10 min to get there after left the highway if you drive. I missed the hotel a couple of times before I eventually got there the first time. The only positive side was about cleaning staff. They would much friendlier than the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Traveler020375
Reviews.Content: Nasty place, dirty from entrance wayy in up to and including the room. Cigarettte butts and garbage overflowing can in the entrance way. Carpeting through out the hotel nasty and I wouldn't let my dog lie on the carpet in my room. Every glass door I passed was fingerprint and grime laden. Every receptacle in the room was loose. The microwave looked it got beat up with a bat. Sheets were thrown on the bed badly wringled. Cigaretter butt burns on the tub. Sink nasty! The hallway outside the room stunk. Noisy as room was next to I-93 forget a restful night sleep. A/C noisly woke you up when it kicked on. Wireless would not reach room, business center a joke,, didn't want a to take a chance on breakfeast if it was anything like the accommodation. Usied priceline...never again! While less expensive than surrounding hotel I iwould have glady paid more to have decent place. Only cure is a D-9 Cat bulldozer starting on one end and leveling it. Sad part was maintenace personnel were about but to busy BS'ing under a tree in the back parking lot. should have spent time cleaning up the place.

Reviews.Title: “I hope they bull doze the place”
Reviews.Author: Janell B
Reviews.Content: We had a late night flight into Boston. I called to have the shuttle pick us up. It took 2 calls to get us picked up. We stood outside over an hour waiting for them. We checked in and were told the best way to the second floor was to go up 2 flights of stairs. We had heavy suitcases packed for a cruise. It was hard getting them up the stairs. We found out the next morning that there was an elevator in the building, but you had to go through a maze of hallways. We had a short night and go up the next morning, ate breakfast. And waited for the shuttle to the Black Falcon Ship Terminal. We had booked a time when we checked in. We waited and waited. Shuttle vans came in but we were told that they were not for us. We complained to the desk and they said we should have taken the shuttle. We had several groups waiting for the shuttle. They finally called in a big shuttle bus to take us to the terminal. The rooms were average, but the service was worse

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Salaman
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I wanted to see a Red Sox game, enjoy some of the historical aspects of Boston, and enjoy some cold beer with good food. This hotel had free parking, an excellent free shuttle to and from the JFK/Mass train ( subway ) station and a free breakfast consisting of make your own waffles, Dannon Lite yogurt, bagels, toast, peanut butter, muffins, bananas, apples, oranges, instant oatmeal, dry cereals, milk, and excellent coffee....served from 6AM-10AM. The corridors are not air-conditioned, but each room has its own air conditioner, which worked very well during the 2 hot days which we spent there. There is a pool in the courtyard with plenty of lounge chairs. The TV is not flat screen, but functioned well and offered many channels Free copies of USA Today are at the front desk. I found this peculiar, since the Boston Globe facility is located just a few blocks from this hotel. The Boston Herald is available for $1 in a coin box outside the main entrance. The front-desk staff was helpful when I did ask various questions. .

Reviews.Title: “Good place for some people.”
Reviews.Author: reader1234
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take the family to downtown boston to see the sights. I didn't want to pay the downtown prices or drive in the downtown core. I found this hotel and decided to give it a try. All the staff were very friendly and greated you whenever you saw them. The exterier of the hotel was very clean. The room was clean but the halls looked water stained because of the air conditioners were in the inclosed hallways(it made the halls very hot). The room and bathroom was smaller than most places we stayed at. The hotel did have a strange layout to it, A lttle confusing at first. The hotel does offer a free shuttle to the airport and to the subway. We took the shuttle and subway two different days, this made it very easy to get into the downtown core. This hotel was about a 15 minute drive to downtown or about 20 minutes with the shuttle and subway dependant on conection time and traffic. There is only one restaurant right near the hotel(next door) and it did have very good food. I could see some people not liking the location and layout of this hotel but for my family and what we planned to see it was what suited us well.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: pinkter
Reviews.Content: Thanks goodness we only booked one night at this hotel. It was the most difficult place to find your room. They had arrows only for a small portion of the floor. It was like a maze. The only redeeming grace was the bedding. While the price was right, we would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: robngaby
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed here during our trip to the Stanley Cup (go Bruins!). I did a bunch of research before we came down and chose this hotel because it had a hot breakfast (just eggs the day we were there but good enough), free shuttle from the airport (which I understood would cost $30 each way!) and good location - close to downtown Boston. Didn't know they also provided a shuttle to the T-line (Red line) subway, which would take you anywhere in Boston including the TD Garden, Fenway, Fenuil Market, Harbor etc. The shuttles ran like clockwork and were awesome. It's not a brand new hotel but it was clean, our room was very nice. I can't help but say it was an awesome trip and the shuttle service probably saved us in the order of $200US during our very short stay in Boston. One thing I would mention on the negative is we went to have a celebratory drink after the Bruins won game 4. My rum and my dad's double scotch cost....$32US! BYOB! Great job Ramada folks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money!”
Reviews.Author: BigFatMeanie
Reviews.Content: For our family of six traveling across the country to see Boston on a tight budget, this motel worked great. To find anything else for a similar price, we would have given up some important benefits that this hotel provided - accessibility to historic Boston, amenities (breakfast, pool, etc.), generally clean and comfortable rooms. A regular shuttle provides transportation to and from the nearest subway station. After watching fireworks on the 4th of July, we didn't get back to the station until well after midnight, so the shuttle had finished running for the night. But it was easy to make arrangements with the hotel to get a shuttle to pick us up. The hotel is in pretty good shape, but is showing a few signs of "growing tired". The rooms were fairly clean, good-sized, and comfortable. The only drawback was the loud air conditioning units in the halls just outside our room (and throughout the motel). They also made the halls fairly hot, stuffy, and we caught a little bit of a musty odor in the halls from time to time. Bad design! Excellent breakfast in regards to both the variety and quality of the food, as well as the dining facilities. The pool is quite nice for a motel pool, it is in a courtyard with an adequate lounging area. The pool staff were particularly friendly and helpful during our four night stay. In general, the staff was responsive and friendly. Overall, you'll be hard pressed to find a motel in Boston that is as affordable without giving up too much in terms of amenities, location, and service.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a good value.”
Reviews.Author: PithSouthCentral_PA
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a very good breakfast. The rooms were neat, but seemed a little tired. The staff was friendly but didn't seem able to help us with questions regarding Boston. Some answers were very incorrect and almost got us stuck without shuttle service late at night. They also seemed very uneducated about the various historical sights and info. about visiting them. Most important was the lack of late night pick-up from the subway drop. We waited at a dark and lonely shuttle stop that I would have been scared to death to be alone at. The night shuttle service was not on time or even close to it. We almost missed getting a ride back to the hotel since we were on the last subway.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the $3 service charge added to your bill”
Reviews.Author: misticdrive
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel along with my cousin and her husband through ParkSleepFly.com. The package included parking and shuttle service to the airport and back, as well as one night's stay at the hotel. The hotel touts its free shuttle service, free internet, and free breakfast on its website and in hotel materials in your room. When we checked in we were asked to initial a statement saying we'd be charged $3/night for "services" including the airport shuttle, the warranty for contents of the safe, and two other items. When I questioned the charge, I was told we would be charged whether we initialed the statement or not. When I spoke with management about this the next morning, I was told the charge covered local phone calls, the supposedly free internet, and the supposedly free breakfast. I asked the manager how she would react if her supermarket tried to charge her $3 for use of a shopping cart when she checked out with her groceries, and she shook her head "no." The charge was subsequently removed from my bill. This kind of "bait and switch" tactic has got to be challenged by travelers. When a hotel quotes you a rate, there should be no fixed service charge added to it, especially when the staff attempts to justify it by saying it covers items that are advertised as "free" on the hotel's website and in the services guide that's in every room. Lastly, I asked that the hotel manager call me at home to discuss the wisdom of sticking customers with a charge they hadn't been told about when they booked their room, was told that he would call, and, of course, he hasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: lynnc22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we flew out of Logan airport. The location was great and the staff friendly. Room was scary. I am not one to complain but all I could think of was a horror movie. I was scared to go to sleep. The light in the bathroom went out so we couldn't see. I couldn't wait to get out of there. We did the parksleepfly package and left our truck for the week. That went well. We couldn't take advantage of the breakfast because we had to leave before they opened. I would never stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Orancathy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ramada this year for my trip to the Boston Marathon. From the moment I was picked up by the hotel shuttle driver I knew I had chosen the best place for my needs. The driver had no sooner pulled away from the airport when he began handing out maps of the transit system to all the runners on board. He clearly explained which stops we neede to take in order to get to the Marathon expo and the race-day busses and informed us that there would be extra shuttles running to and from the transit station all weekend. Although breakfast normally begins at 6, they began service at 5am on race day to ensure the guests would have a chance eat before leaving for the race. There is also free coffee available 24 hours a day - a big perk for some. The hotel is an older building, but my room was clean, well lit, with a comfortable bed and cable TV. There was a problem with the hot water the first day I was there, but maintenance quickly dealt with this. (They actually arrived within 5 minutes of me reporting the problem) I had leftovers from my supper and, although there was no fridge in my room, the staff kept it overnight in the fridge behind the counter for me. The hotel was completly booked but I was in bed by 9pm each night and did not find things at all noisy. If you do not have a vehicle, the hotel is well situated as, there is a drug store, liquor store, and a wonderful deli / market directly across the street.The frequent shuttles to the subway station and the short duration of the subway ride into town make one feel like they are staying close to downtown without the burdens of a downtown price! I would recommend this hotel to someone who is looking for inexpensive, friendly accomodations. There is no fitness centre, but guests have the use of the one in the Comfort Inn a block away should they want to work out.

Reviews.Title: “"" The WORST HOTEL in the U.S.A "" hotel for those who want to be robbed in room”
Reviews.Author: FryderykR
Reviews.Content: I staied at Ramada Hotel in Boston in last summer;we saw this hotel in in internet and from there booked with credit card. When we arrived the hotel said us that there was no the 2 rooms booked even if we had the paper with the reservation ( TERRIBLE ) . After two hours arrived the person responsible for the reception (annoyed and scorbutic) that said us :"There is only one room booked"...................... After few time we were obliged to take another room outside of the reservation by internet (INCREDIBLE)..Another few minutes and we got the card to open the bedroom so finally we went in the bedroom! - - - the first impression from outside is only an appearance because when you go in the corridor to the rooms there are motors of air conditioners (the corridor is not open to the air but is close and very hot ,because heated by the motor of the air condition). in the next day they not cleaned the room,that was very dirty.. (one motel perhaps is better) In the finally we went to pay and...surprise..there was 250$ of external calls in some place in the world... (how is possible this thing)??........... ..they sad that we didn't do that calls but our credit card was blocked with the hotel and 2 hours after the flight had a thundering house and we paid anyway because otherwise we would have lost the ticket to fly value of $ 900... ____DO NOT GO IN THIS HOTEL_____

Reviews.Title: “NO WAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wifeyhi
Reviews.Content: Normally when my husband and I are flying out of Logan to home in Hawaii we stay @ the Hilton at Logan Airport. I made the decision to be cheap and stay here. We had a 5:30 am flight so we just stayed 12 hrs. NO hot water, NO 3am wake up call, NO HEAT-It was snowing outside. We stupidly didn't complain because it was only 12 hrs. The only good thing about the experience were the employees. The shuttle driver was great as were the people at the front desk. The entire place looked like it was a motel in the 60's and they enclosed the walkways. It's gonna be Hilton for us from now on. Lesson learned!!! ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “Will DEFINITELY stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: riverworks
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston recently for a trade show and stayed at the Ramada on Morrissey Blvd. The stay was a very pleasant surprise. The room was cleanand the bed VERY comfortable. The Continental breakfast was fabulous - hot waffles, scrambled eggs, prepared hot oatmeal as well as the usual bakery items, cold cereals, juices and coffee. Though that part was great, the best was yet to come. The entire staff was amazing, treating everyone (other staff members and guests alike) as family. Kudos to staff, owners and management for a job well done. I would definitely recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, safe place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Murdocki
Reviews.Content: The hotel had great amenities such as the 24 hour bowling alley on the property, restuarants, complimentary breakfast, free access to the computer and a nearby grocey store. The room was clean. It was hot inside the hotel, but the AC made the room comfortable quickly. There's a shuttle to the T for easy access downtown, and it's a reasonable cab fare on the way home if split a few ways. No liquor store nearby. If you're staying there for a night out in Boston just bring what you need with you and the rates make it a very practical experience. The hotel rooms need to be upgraded. The room was musty and dark, toilet overflowed the 2nd day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were caught in the aftermath of the recent blizzard, and had to overnight in Boston to catch a flight the next day. So glad we found this place - what a delightful experience. The shuttle driver was polite and personable, knew how to avoid rush hour traffic. Extremely tired when we reached the hotel, we did not take advantage of the coupons for nearby food retailers (free piece of handmade fudge; free bowl of chowder with purchase - both from adjacent businesses). We had specified a Queen bed when making the reservation. The first room we were given had two double beds; it was so cozy we were tempted to keep it. Upon notifying the front desk, we were promptly assigned a room with a queen bed, again clean, cozy, very comfortable. I had some leftovers, which I was able to warm in the microwave in the breakfast room. Staff even checked us in for our morning flight and printed our boarding passes. We slept like rocks, and awoke in time for a delicious, relaxed breakfast (scrambled eggs, make-it-yourself Belgian waffles, real butter, regular and fat-free syrups, crock pot full of delicious hot oatmeal, raisins and brown sugar, assortment of breads and bagels for toasting, muffins juices, coffee, tea, hot chocolate). We left, stuffed, on a timely shuttle to arrive at Logan terminal C for our mandatory scope or grope....but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada has lost a customer for life”
Reviews.Author: mharley4
Reviews.Content: When my wife called the hotel to confirm the rates we found at Ramada.com, the clerk told her he had no record of such a rate and unless we book it through the website, he would not honor that rate. So we booked it through the website and drove over to Ramada Inn at 800 Morrissey Boulevard, near Freeport St, Boston, MA 02122. Staying at the room was my wife and my children. It was around 1am on Jan 1, 2011. I told the clerk we had a reservation. He checked the system and told me that there wasn't one in the system but that he could get me a room at his regular rate. I asked him how long would it take to come up in the system. He said that he didn't know but I was welcomed to sit in the lobby until it did. I asked if I gave him my card number, could this somehow be expedited. He said no. It was pretty clear that he wasn't really trying to help me. I told him I would just find another hotel as he walked into his office behind the counter. I went back to the car and called the 800 number for Ramada to find out what was happening and to complain about the poor service. The representative apologized but basically told me that the system was down and to call back in 10 mins. Why she didn't take my number and offer to call me back let me know that Ramada's customer service problem is pandemic. I called back in 15 mins to give them one last chance. This gentleman told me that it was nothing he could do as the system was still down and he had no idea when it would be back up. He suggested I pay the regular rate. I asked if I paid the regular rate, when the system comes up, will there be an adjustment to bill. He told me that would be up to the clerk at the hotel. I told him that I won't be using Ramada afterall. And they have lost a customer for life. We went to Comfort Inn down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Spankems
Reviews.Content: I am still here so I reserve the right to revise or amend my opinion. Every traveler has his or her own personal experiences good and bad. This is mine so far: Check in was fast, room was clean and bed comfy. I am here so I do not have to commute to the hospital where my wife is for a few days. The shuttle to the train is great and on time. I drove to the hospital before checking in and Boston traffic is tough so I am avoiding that with the shuttle and the train. Breakfast is decent and loved the waffles. WiFi worked great, I am using it right now in fact. The biggest negative is trying to find the hotel. If you do not have a GPS good luck. Some complained of cleanliness issues but there is no problem here for me but I did not get under the bed or search for mice poops. I might after reading one review. The rate is the best in Boston. You can find upscale hotels but be prepared to drop another hundred bucks a night at least. If things go down hill I will revise my comments but soon I will be off to make my own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: keanu_maverick
Reviews.Content: We went for conference in Boston University. Booked three rooms in Ramada Inn. The hotel is a little upscale among motels. I liked the morning breakfast as the most. It was fresh, clean and hygienic.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky and dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: sprp07
Reviews.Content: Very small room and view around hotel is bad.Not romantic at all.We went there to relax for two days but we end up fighting because of that small room.My husband saw a picture of room on internet,so he thought its nice big clean room but its opposite.We went there at night so we did not had choice because it was late to find another hotel.We stayed there that night but then we checked out and went to other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: SUSANLILACROSE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to boarding our cruise, it was a little further out Boston than I thought it would be although a shuttle runs from the hotel to the train station. It stands next to a busy motorway and we got given a room next to the motorway, hence we had no sleep the first night. They were happy to swap our rooms the next morning and slept fine after that. Nice comfy beds and I found it to be very clean and well kept. The breafast is fantastic, such a choice, its a real bonus. For a overnight stay its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kindl22712
Reviews.Content: We traveled from upstate NY down to Boston. It was dark by the time we arrived and the location was tricky to get to. Thank God for GPS! Room was adequate and fairly well maintained. . Our view from our room was of the parking lot. The location is convenient as I understand there is a shuttle to the train into downtown Boston. We didn't make use of it ourselves, but the front desk was helpful in letting us know about the Beantown Trolley which has a tourist package to take you around the sights. The trolley picks you up at the hotel and brings you back in the evening. The motel is beginning to show it's age, but overall is maintained okay. The continental breakfast is good, although crowded. Pricewise I found it fairly expensive, but that was until I priced a few of the other motels in the area. They get a lot of air travelers and were filled up the night we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Family run, no surprises adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: A family run, no surprises hotel. The construction of the original hotel and subsequent renovations has left the rooms vulnerable to disruptive noise from the corridors and the antiquated air-conditioning units are incredibly noisy. Rooms have very little natural light and are not cosy with budget equipment, budget bed linen/towels/beds/bathrooms. That being said, it was clean and relatively comfortable for our 3 night stay. On the plus side, the staff are very efficient and issues are sorted quickly plus there is a shuttle bus to take you from the hotel to the local metro station (JFK/U Mass stop). $2 to get easily to downtown Boston makes access to the city very convenient. Across the road from the Ramada is a food store which does great takeaway salads & pastries. We were told there was a liquor store close by (but did not seek out) and the attaching bar/restaurant has adequate (but not great) food/beer. Tip: if coming into Boston international airport you need to call the hotel to ask them to send the shuttle bus for the airport pickup. There is a charge of $3 per day levied to cover the shuttle buses which is not advised on their website. There was a disturbance at 3 a.m. on Saturday night in the hotel corridors but there appeared to be adequate security on the premises to handle it. Not a place for children despite the bowling alley next door.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning staff instructed to wake you up early”
Reviews.Author: chubbs10
Reviews.Content: Check out time is 12 pm.Cleaning staff knocked on door at 0820 to ask if I was staying another night, when i stated I was not she said ok. When I asked why she would wake me up she stated "well your leaving today, no?" Front desk woman told me "they have to wake you up to clean the rooms" They have a computer, they know when people check out. tv does not work, hall in front of room flooded and musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: isummers1
Reviews.Content: Considering the proximity to Boston for the price the room and pool facilities were good and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Shuttle service was excellent, we never had to wait for more than 15minutes at either the Ramada or the JFK/UMass "T" even after 11pm. The driver was also very helpful in giving onward directions to someone new in town. Only downside for us was the included breakfast which was something of a melee, the room was far too small, there were too few staff to keep everything topped up and there didn't seem to be any discernable queueing system. All in all though this is not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware, it is not what it appears to be!”
Reviews.Author: YKexplorers
Reviews.Content: They advertise a continental breakfast - if you like microwave eggs. Be aware. Be sure to get there before 8:00, or there will be no room to sit. They advertise a shuttle. be aware, the schedule that they advertise is not followed. you can be waiting at the hotel, or at the transit station, for more than 90 minutes for a shuttle. And the best be aware of all - they will quote you a price when you arrive, and then when you check out they tell you that price was only for one night, and it goes up after that.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: zazded
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i booked this hotel because it was near Boston and cheap. The hotel offers free parking, free wifi in the room, free breakfest. You are near the train(metro)station.(3km) You can take the free shuttle. If you want to visit Boston without paying a fortune for the room it's a good choice. we had a room on the second floor. Very quiet.Very comfy bed nice blanket. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Stay”
Reviews.Author: lkohley
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came for a girls weekend and were dissappointed with our room. The website is untrue with its description. It smelled terrible and we just used that as a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Skip This One”
Reviews.Author: Dannied
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for a weekend. The pictures are not a good representation of the hotel. It was old and noisy. The bathroom was tiny and the rugs were dirty. The blankets were so old that it looked like they were washed 100 times and there were cigarette holes in it. The bed was also uncomfortable. This hotel was way over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with free shuttle to metro and free parking”
Reviews.Author: si_mongoose
Reviews.Content: If you want to leave you're car for free and make your way into Boston on the excellent metro system (or 'T') then this is a good option. Although not cheap, the rates are very reasonable for Boston. The parking is free and they operate a twice hourly shuttle to the JFK/UMass T station, which is about 15 mins to Park street (for Boston Common, visitor centre and the start of the freedom trail). No real disadvantages that we came accross.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with hotel”
Reviews.Author: tybeegirlOhio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during graduation at Harvard. Very busy and hot temperatures! Elevator broken first day. No one available to help us with bags to third floor. Next morning, no hot water for shower. Next two days, limited hot water for showers. Staff not very helpful. Food ran out at breakfast bar (fruit and long line for one waffle iron). Front desk called for taxi service they contract with....after 30 minute wait we took the shuttle to the subway instead.

Reviews.Title: “Shanty”
Reviews.Author: Shanty101
Reviews.Content: Walking through the windy hallway was only the beginning of our illustrious adventure that is the Ramada Boston. From the outside if you can get past the bowling alley/arcade that looks similar to a strip joint that is not so bad. Once you walk in the people at the front dsk were friendly, on to our room. We didn't take the elevator becuse it looked like it belonged in the movie "Saw" so we opted for a quick run up the stairs. We felt so uncomfortable we figured we would double lock the door. Turns out we couldn't even do that bcause th chain, yes a chain was missing the bolt. We called immeadately to the front desk they responds quickly and fixed it. There is one useable outlet the is four feet fom the nightstand makng useless to humans. The sink looks like it should be used by toodlers it is so low to the ground. The smoke detector is missing batteries making me feel very safe. The bed is like a cardboard box wraped in sheets. Not very comfy. Seriously, this place is shantyville, stay elsewhere for your safety.

Reviews.Title: “Has pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: hopalott
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the price and the fact that it took pets without a fee. The hotel lobby is decent with a sitting area off the the side of the front desk. The lounge are has a computer, but no time limit, so you take your chances for availability. This is a nonsmoking hotel, but the first room we got reeked of smoke. We easily changed rooms. The shuttle runs about every 30 minutes, so transportation took time from the airport and especially to/from the commuter train system. The front desk staff was generally friendly and responsive to requests. However, we were in Boston during a period of a water main break which made drinking water unavailable all throughout the area. The staff became less responsive when we asked for water and were stingy with their bottled supply. This hotel is good if you need an inexpensive room and have pets. The rooms were average clean (carpets could use more vacuuming around the edges)

Reviews.Title: “Ramada”
Reviews.Author: talulu6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport and has shuttle service, thats why we booked it. we had a good expereince overall...wasnt too expensive but also not cheap... but thats probablly b/c it's closed to a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel that doesn't break the bank!”
Reviews.Author: 1883Tiger
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed myself, Great hospitality, friendly and helpful staff (both on reception, in the taverns and drivers of shuttle buses), clean rooms, comfortable bed, tv, internet, courtesy daily paper, shuttle bus from airport and to local MBTA T Station (JFK/UMass) great adjoining taverns (really enjoyed the Steak Tips and Sam Adams Seasonal Beer), Great healthy Breakfast (Cheerios, Yoghurt, Fruit Bread, Apple Juice and Coffee) and all this for under Â£50 a night..What more could anyone ask for...Absolute Bargain!! Also enjoyed having my own room as I usually go hostelling...............and can now snore to my hearts content, without waking anyone!! lol

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: Spanielowner
Reviews.Content: Room was not the greatest. Found a few items left by another guest, this did not thrill me to say the least. Service was ok but they were more interested in talking to each other than to me. Glad I was not paying out of my own pocket for this.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: JerzieJennie
Reviews.Content: Well, its not the most glamorous hotel, but usually, we dont care. We dont travel to stay in our hotel rooms all day. The room was clean. Yes, the place is confusing to navigate, but after you figure out your way, its not so bad. The staff was extremely helpful. There is also a laundromat style laundry on the ground floor. Breakfast was great for a free breakfast. The shuttles proved invaluable! We were out of the hustle and bustle of the city, but had direct access. Boston has a GREAT and easily understandable underground train system. You can get passes for around ten bucks that will allow you unlimited use all day. The shuttle ran every half an hour until late evening, and after that time, all you had to do was call, and the shuttle would come get you at the train station. Yes, it may be a 20 minute wait - but its a free ride. If you want instant response, call a taxi. This location was at LEAST a hundred dollars cheaper than anywhere we could find to stop at in the city. We were able to stay an extra day to save money, and enjoyed being able to explore on the train. If you want to use the internet, you have to pay 5-10 bucks for a card that gets you onto their outdated computer with little or no volume. The location of the Ramada is rather remote. You can only access the bowling/billiards/entertainment building across the parking lot, or the brew house on the other side. Other than that, you're on a speedy road, and cannot easily walk to anything else. If you plan on spending all of your time in Boston, this shouldnt matter much.

Reviews.Title: “Better to Sleep on the Bus Station Floor”
Reviews.Author: travels_321
Reviews.Content: This place was paid for by the institution that brought me to town for an interview. I usually stay at budget hotels. This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. There is a warren of cold and windy hallways with no signs and I had to come back to the front desk multiple times to find my room. When I found it, I was overpowered by the smell of cigarettes and urine. The room was dark and dirty with holes in and tears in the carpet. I asked to switch to a different non-smoking room, which had less urine smell but a dirtier blanket on the bed. There was hair and dirt on the blanket. The heater was loud and turned on with a bang every 15-20 minutes. I took the blanket off the bed and turned off the heater and slept in my clothes. Everything in the room looked dirty and abused.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Park and Fly program”
Reviews.Author: Foxden
Reviews.Content: This allows you to leave your car for up to 14 days, stay one night and use the shuttle to and from the airport. It was almost the same cost to just you the Preflight parking lot only. Room was clean and actually ended up being a suite. There was a mix up in the am with the shuttle getting to the airport, but they were able to get someone to bring us and upon our return we only waited about 15 min for a shuttle. The hotel has a strange set up with hallways that go through doors and end up being like a maze, but it served it's purpose and the bed was comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and Low Cost”
Reviews.Author: PatWV
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Ramada for 1 night before a cruise for $89 (special rate on Expedia). They have a shuttle to the airport which we used and were promptly picked up and delivered to the hotel. Check-in was fast and despite the early hour (11 am) we were given a room key and directions. You should be warned that the hotel is a maze and room number signage does not correspond to reality. The rooms are adequate but have the grim, low budget look of this type of hotel. The breakfast is continental, served until 10 am with cold cereals, donuts/muffins, coffee, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. The hotel advertises shuttle service to close-by locations (the T and restaurants) but a single shuttle runs at night so you may end up waiting an hour to be picked up. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere with few eating options except for the attached restaurants that stop serving at 10 pm. Nothing is walking distance so you will have to use the shuttle, the T or a car. If you don't care about ambience or the closeness of attractions and want a low price, decent option for a low price, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sambruce
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Boston to see universities for my 16 y.o.daughter and brought along the two brothers and our exchange student from Belgium living with us. 4 nights and 2 rooms in Boston cold ring up a big price tag but the Ramana Inn in Boston provided us with a great place to stay. The shuttles between Logan and the JFK subway station were GREAT!!! We were there 4 days and used the shuttles alot - the drivers were courteous, helpful and generally on time. The breakfast buffet was also a reat value and a good start on long days. I'd stay there again and would highly recommend the Boston Ramada to anyone. One tip - ask for a room away from the freeway - we could hear the whoosh of cars on the freeway in the evenings when the television was not on. It was not a problem and didnt keep anyone up, but we knew the highway was close by. All in all a great place to stay in Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenience, and comfort”
Reviews.Author: traveler0914
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews here that sound like people expecting the Ritz when they pay for a Ramada. I researched all the budget hotels for my trip to Boston and this Ramada was the best price in the area. I came expecting a simple room for a business traveler to sleep in. I did not expect a continental breakfast or a fridge in my room, or room service from a neighboring restaurant...but I got all of them during my stay. The hotel is located close to the freeway and is a short drive to downtown Boston. Nearby restaurants, grocery store, and a bowling alley are within walking distance. A restaurant and brewery across the street delivers room service (including beer!) to your room. I had an issue where the hotel booked an additional night to extend my stay, which I had inquired about when I arrived. My card was charged for the additional night even though I didn't stay there. I called the hotel and spoke to the district manager, who was happy to refund the charge. It took a couple minutes of my time and no hassling. In fact, the entire staff was friendly during my stay, and my experience there has been better than at other Ramadas in the past.

Reviews.Title: “good money saver”
Reviews.Author: kc-bos09
Reviews.Content: This hotel, has breakfast and shuttle service to the airport and to the subway included. Hotel is older and a bit of a maze. But, Rooms are clean, bed is made fresh everyday, same fresh towels if needed. Breakfast is included, lots to choose from, however the breakfast area was a little crowded and small, at peak times it is hard to find a place to sit. Shuttle service is nice, but only runs certain times, it is only van which will only hold 12 people max, you might have to wait for the next one, if you are in a time crunch leave early!

Reviews.Title: “Great place w/ reasonable prices and free shuttle service to train station day + night.”
Reviews.Author: keegansfraeulein
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely nice, knowledgable, and helpful. The hotel itself a 20-minute train ride and there's a free shuttle service to the train station offered by the hotel. It's even available at night. The trains stop operating around midnight though. Free breakfast w/ wide variety. Rooms are modern and clean. I felt OK using everything w/o having to sanitize it myself first. No complaints about the room at all. They advertized a pool but is was dirty and unusable; green from the algae. That was the only negative part of the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: kafde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located outside the city it was a good value for our needs. Located close to the subway with shuttle running frequently from the hotel. Area can be a little seady in the evenings but if you plan to spend most of your time in the city enjoying the sites its a great deal

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Elvis_vivant
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location (near I-93, subway stations, JFK Library) and free parking, but don't expect to spend a weekend in your room. It's a place to stay when you're there to visit Boston and go to bed at the end of the evening. The breakfast is good : scrambled eggs and french toasts are the only hot items though (no bacon, pancake, sausages or ham). There are restaurants next door (tavern, cafe).

Reviews.Title: “very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: pinkdancer1987
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel it seemed pleasant enough, and the room was what we expected for the price (however it was late at night, and we were just grateful to go to sleep) in the morning, we found the breakfast a little disapointing. Although there seems to be a variety of different foods, it gets so busy in the small breakfast room that you end up queing out of the door. Then by the time you get your food, theres the matter of finding a table, which proved very difficult each morning. We decided to try one of the resaurants the hotel recommends to its guests to be bitterly disapointed. The food was over priced for what it was, and tasted awful (maybe they were having a bad day!). And to top the whole experience off, upon checking out, we find that our car has been broken into! The whole drivers side window was smashed with some valuable items stolen. Bearing in mind that the car was in fact parked in the hotel car park, the Assistant Manager was completely unsympathetic and took no responsibility for the damage, saying the area is notorious for criminals and it was our choice to park the car there! What a cheek! The website didnt warn us of this before we stayed there! They completely took advantage of us as a young couple. And 3 weeks later, we still don't have the answers we are looking for. Saying that, the only good service the hotel provides is the free shuttle to JFK train station which takes you straight to the city. The driver was very pleasent and always on time to take us and pick us up. All in all we will NOT be staying there again, and do not recommend this hotel to anyone to go here. Seeing as it is a notorious "area" we suggest you leave all valuables at home, including your car apparently!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refurb”
Reviews.Author: Lostmymojo
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on a business trip. Basically it's clean and tidy but the fixtures and fittings are worn out and the air conditioning noisy. The staff were helpful and unlike other reports my experience of the shuttles to the "T "and Logan Airport was good. I booked on line and gained the impression the hotel was situated close to downtown Boston. Believe me it isn't! Unless you take a cab getting anywhere interesting involves a 10 minute ride on the shuttle (every half hour) and 20 minutes on the "T". The associated Freeport Tavern Pub next door has just been refurbished and is a pleasant place for a meal and a beer. Hopefully the rest of the hotel will upgraded to the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff are exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: SaraMississippi
Reviews.Content: The staff told us about a trolley tour that would pick us up at the front door and give us a tour of Boston. If we were late getting back to ride the subway to a certain station and call the coutresy van to pick us up. Everything was wonderful with no driving in the city. Free parking. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast is great. I would stay here again. Sara Booneville MS

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: JumperJoe
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that i've ever stayed in. I would not go there again and would not recommend it to anyone. The room was clean on the surface but the hotel seemed extremely dirty and in a state of disrepair. It just had a really dirty and shabby feel to it. Dont go there if you can avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not-so-good”
Reviews.Author: mks03
Reviews.Content: Let's get the not-so-good out of the way. Service: Our room was right next to the housekeeping room. The housekeepers spend what I thought was considerable time chatting in front of our room. They could use some training to keep voices down. Part of staying in hotels/motels is putting up with inconsiderate fellow travelers who talk loudly outside of your door. But I would expect the staff to be more aware of this. I don't want to hear you visiting outside my room, especially when I'm trying to sleep. Also, the room was near the pool and it rained/drizzled through most of our stay. You would have thought there was a monsoon, by the racket of the rain falling on the pool overhang. Imagine a tin roof..... And..... While we were there, the fire alarm went off at about 12;15 in the morning. We went out into the hallway, where some staff gestured for us to go outside. So there we are in the front of the place with our jammies on. The fire truck comes and goes, then we go back to our room. OK--no harm, no foul. We want to be safe, not sorry. But then about an hour later, the alarm goes off AGAIN! Luckily, it quickly got turned off, but not before we were awake with hearts pounding. Any follow up on this? Any: apologies or comments of any sort from mgt or front desk? No, none whatsoever. Location: Good and bad. Boston apparently has been doing road construction for the past few years. While we were there, there was construction occurring right on the frontage road where the motel is. With the one-way streets nearby, it took us about 15 mintues to figure out how to get into the place. I don't think we're of below-average intelligence! I know this isn't the motel's fault, but getting in and out was a production. Now the good: Shuttle bus to the subway. Driver was friendly and helpful Shuttle runs every half hour to and from. It also goes to the airport, although we didn't use if for that. Breakfast: cereal, fruit, french toast, scrambled eggs, coffe, tea, milk, and juice. Better than the average motel continental breakfast. Also--next door to the motel is an awesome candy store with homemade chocolate...high quality stuff! Next to the candy store is a bowling alley with a snack bar. Looks fun, if we had more time we would have gone. On other side of motel is a nice restaurant with good food. I will recommend this place, but request a room upstairs, far away from housekeeping headquarters and the pool. Also, call for directions so you don't get confused by the nearby streets.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: gemmablue
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about the location, but there is a shuttle every 30 minutes that goes back and forth to the nearest T stop, so that was very convenient. The room was spacious, fairly quiet (in spite of the fact that the hotel is adjacent to the expressway), comfortably and it had a mini-fridge and microwave, which was great. There's also a free full breakfast with a waffle station, eggs, toast, cereal, juice, various muffins, bagels, etc. Especially for the price, we couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Leave your valuables at home!!”
Reviews.Author: JerryMaine
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Ramada Inn on Morressey Blvd. in Boston was the absolute worst I've ever experienced. We checked in the evening before my daughter was to be admitted in the morning at Boston Medical Center due to a heart condition. Upon waking we found that there was no running water for my daughter could shower before surgery. When I complained I didn't get an apology, instead I simply heard from the manager that it was outside the building. It was also raining outside, and in. It came running through the ceiling, wetting the carpet. On my second night, while out to dinner next door to the hotel (total time 45 minutes) my laptop was stolen off the bed in our room. Again, there was no competent management to be found. They acted as though it happened all the time or something. They did an "incident report" over the phone with me rather than in person. All-in-all, it was a horrible experience. And when I complained to the Corporate offices of the Ramada they said that it was beyond their ability to address since it was privately owned. I felt as though no one really cared. No free stays were offered for my troubles nor did they refund any the cost already paid, which would have gone a long way toward making me a little happier. Don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: 2LabsMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband, niece and nephew and I came to Boston for the June 13 "Walk With Us to Cure Lupus". The hotel was comfortable and the staff (including the restaurant servers) very friendly and accommodating. The hotel gives very good value and was ideally located close to the harbor and Castle Island (where our event was held). Free internet was very much appreciated by my 20-something travel companions, and it was a joy to bring our two black Labs on the trip. Owner Ed Friedrich was a wonderful host!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Great Staff - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: necmusic
Reviews.Content: We came to Boston for a friend's Graduation from Northeastern University, which is in Back Bay. We were hesitant because the Ramada is in South Boston - and about 2 miles from the T station. The hotel staff were great. The hotel shuttle runs like clockwork and had us to the T in no time. I was amazed how quickly we could travel to just about anywhere in Boston - much quicker than if we had driven. Although the lobby, dining area and business center look great, the hallways were very dingy - new carpeting would go a long way. The room was fine, although again, a bit dated and worn. The beds were typical hotel - a little hard - nothing special but we had no trouble sleeping. The breakfasts were good (I loved making my own waffles). Overall, the hotel could use an upgrade, but for convenience and price (less than $100 a night) we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: jbates1997
Reviews.Content: They treat you like family. Big delux breakfest, shuttle service to the Falcon (ships), Airport and Train Station. We returned from a 13 day cruise from New Orleans to Boston and found the best hotel in Boston...jjb

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: dr_evil_dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four nights, two rooms. The Hotel is close to downtown but it is right off of I93. Occaisonally you could hear the commuter trains across the way but it wasn't bad. Rooms were clean and comfortable. A/C heat units are a bit noisy but in this class of hotel they always are. The only negative was the $1/day for the "safe" in the room. I thought that was a bit cheesy. The WIfi was a bit quirky as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: raymo66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Ramada in Boston MA this past January for a work related stay. I stayed for 2 1/2 weeks and let me tell you, this staff could not have gone more out of their way to please their guests! They were awesome! They did not charge for faxes; made copies when I needed them; Printed up many direction sheets for me... the list could go on for days. They always smiled and made time to keep good conversation with the guests. My room was cleaned every day. The housekeeping department is also very good and friendly. When ever I needed extra linen, all I had to do is call the desk and it was there in minutes. The shuttles were great! Very punctual unless the weather slowed them down. The drivers are extremely personable. I highly recommed this hotel for business and pleasure trips! Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and not clean”
Reviews.Author: lobbyone
Reviews.Content: We were drawn by the price and availability. This Ramada is old and dirty. The rooms were not clean. We were put on the 3rd floor but soon realized the Elevator Motor Assembly was behind the wall right behind the headboard! It made a squealing awful noise with each passenger ALL NIGHT LONG. It was impossible to sleep. They did move us to another room the following day when we asked to change. They didn't seem happy. This other room was even dirtier and older.The sheets were thread bare and the carpets dirty. I saw on my credit card account they charged us a higher rate other than what I signed on my bill. The saving grace was the free shuttle to Logan and the T. Free breakfast is offered, breads,yogurt, and hot waffles.If you are not going to be in your room at all you may like this place for the price. NOT walking distance to anything ,but cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Best night's sleep - ever!”
Reviews.Author: onlinegal
Reviews.Content: My family and I had some reservations (pardon the pun) when we saw this place since it seemed old and a little musty. However, the rooms were comfortable and I had the best night's sleep I've ever had thanks to the awesome pillows! I even had an amazing dream that allowed me to awaken with a beautiful, spiritual connection to the Universe. I certainly didn't expect that from a cheap hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but not very clean”
Reviews.Author: aylee
Reviews.Content: STAY DETAILS July 19-21, 2008 1 queen room, 1 handicapped queen room Price: $129.99/night Government rate at Ramada.com You may get a cheaper rate walking in instead of reserving online. There are hotel coupons in almost every rest stop in the highways to Boston. However, it was peak season (summer) so we decided to reserve in advance. LOCATION The location is South Boston, but it was still convenient. There was free scheduled shuttle to the JFK/UMass subway station (MBTA) and the airport. There are restaurants on site, the Phillips candy/chocolate store and a family entertainment complex that had bowling, arcade, pool and more. Stores such as CVS, National Wholesale Liquidator and other stuff, are just across the street. The location is the best asset of this property, but that was it. PREMISES The place had ample parking and seating in the lobby. The hotel layout was very poorly planned. Other reviewers complained that the hotel was a maze, and it was. Even the front desk staff got confused. To go to one side of the hotel, you will have to go through at least 3 doors. STAFF The staff were friendly, but they need to be more knowledgeable. We had to switch rooms because the first rooms we had were too far from the exit and we had a handicapped kid with us. A staff gave us wrong directions to get to the rooms, but he was apologetic. The keys to one of the rooms weren't working and I had to go back to front desk twice. The front desk didn't have a map of the area, only downtown Boston and Cambridge. ROOMS There was a strong smell in the rooms. It looked like housekeeping sprayed too much air deodorizer to mask other smells. I didn't think the rooms were too clean. One of the rooms we booked (handicapped) had poop in the toilet. The other room was alright, but when we tried to use the extra pillows in the 'closet', they smelled like sweat.
